meanings.definition: Lacking qualities traditionally associated with being a man.
meanings.sent1: His unmanful behavior during the crisis surprised everyone.
meanings.sent2: Crying openly is often seen as unmanful in some cultures.
meanings.sent3: The knight's unmanful squeal echoed through the battlefield.
meanings.sent4: His unmanful retreat from the challenge left a mark on his reputation.
meanings.sent5: The unmanful way he avoided confrontation was noticeable to all.

meanings.definition: Not characteristic of a man; unmanly.
meanings.sent1: Her unmanful decision to give up without a fight disappointed her friends.
meanings.sent2: The villain's unmanful acts of deceit were despised by all.
meanings.sent3: Wearing a pink tutu to the gym was definitely unmanful, but it made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His unmanful behavior in the face of danger was like a cowardly mouse.
meanings.sent5: The unmanful way he avoided responsibility was evident to everyone around him.
